greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Terms of A000203 that are prime.
comment: Sorted and duplicates removed, this gives A023195.
link: Harry J. Smith and Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..100 from Harry J. Smith)
example: sigma(2) = 3, sigma(4) = 7, sigma(9) = 13 are the first three prime terms of A000203. Hence the sequence starts 3, 7, 13.
program: (MAGMA) [ c: n in [1..1000000] | IsPrime(c) where c:=SumOfDivisors(n) ]; // _Klaus Brockhaus_, Oct 21 2009
(PARI) { n=0; for (m=1, 10^9, if(isprime(a=sigma(m)), write("b062700.txt", n++, " ", a); if (n==100, break)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 09 2009
A062700_list = [3]+[n for n in (divisor_sigma(d**2) for d in range(1,10**4)) if isprime(n)] # _Chai Wah Wu_, Jul 23 2016
xref: Cf. A000203 (sigma(n), sum of divisors of n), A023194, A034885 (record values of sigma(n)), A023195 (prime numbers that are the sum of the divisors of some n), A100382 (record values of A062700).
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Jul 11 2001
